intro: Hieracium leioglossum, commonly known as the smooth-tongued hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, with both ray and disc florets. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces seeds through a process called cleistogamy, where flowers close and self-pollinate before opening.
